meanings.definition: An act of exchanging favors for mutual benefit, especially in politics.
meanings.sent1: During the election, there was a logroll between the two candidates to gain more support.
meanings.sent2: The logroll between the politicians helped them both achieve their goals.
meanings.sent3: The logroll in the government was so obvious, it almost seemed like a game.
meanings.sent4: The logroll in the office was like a dance of give and take.
meanings.sent5: The logroll made the political process smoother and more efficient.

meanings.definition: To engage in mutual favor-trading for personal gain.
meanings.sent1: They decided to logroll to ensure both of them benefited from the deal.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often logroll to advance their own agendas.
meanings.sent3: The friends jokingly agreed to logroll their chores for the week.
meanings.sent4: In the business world, sometimes you have to logroll to get ahead.
meanings.sent5: She knew she had to logroll if she wanted to succeed in the competitive industry.
